author: mehdi.aouadi
content: Could you please clarify if the cpu graph is user or system cpu usage?

author: parithosh
content:
The query is from node_exporter:
```
100 - (avg by (ingress_user,instance) (rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", network=~"$network", consensus_client=~"$consensus_client", execution_client=~"$execution_client"}[1m])) * 100)
```
So its 100 - time CPU spent idle represented as a %. More info here: https://www.robustperception.io/understanding-machine-cpu-usage/

author: dapplion
content:
Why do the sum by instance in this metric?
```prom
sum by (instance)(rate(node_network_receive_bytes_total{network=~"$network", consensus_client=~"$consensus_client", execution_client=~"$execution_client", device!="lo"}[$__interval]))
```

author: barnabasbusa
content: we usually care about bandwith per node

author: barnabasbusa
content: not per client

author: dapplion
content: That mixes local traffic between the two clients with external traffic

author: parithosh
content:
We also launched Xatu on this network, its a p2p monitoring tool that sam and andrew built. It launches a "Sentry" that subscribes to the event stream of the CL and parses the data for ingestation in a database. That database can be interacted with via jyupiter/other notebooks or grafana. 

We set this up on 15 nodes, 3 of each client.

The following are snapshots from the grafana dashboard. You will be able to see:
- Time the block took to propagate to every node, you can see the avg, max, min, p95 and so on
- Heatmap of block propagation
- Time the block attestations took to propagate to every node, you can see the avg, max, min, p95 and so on
- Heatmap of attestatoin propagation

This dashboard is currently hidden away in a separate, internal grafana instance. Access can be provided if needed.

author: parithosh
content: Yea i'm also noticing that on ethdo calls while trying to collect info on chian health...

author: parithosh
content:
Based on the last two epochs:
```
Epoch 15:
  Proposals: 25/32 (78.12%)
  Attestations: 866511/2100000 (41.26%)
    Source timely: 857032/2100000 (40.81%)
    Target correct: 866511/2100000 (41.26%)
    Target timely: 866511/2100000 (41.26%)
    Head correct: 784420/2100000 (37.35%)
    Head timely: 595189/2100000 (28.34%)
  Sync committees: 7707/12800 (60.21%)
Epoch 16:
  Proposals: 22/32 (68.75%)
  Attestations: 793252/2100000 (37.77%)
    Source timely: 738379/2100000 (35.16%)
    Target correct: 793252/2100000 (37.77%)
    Target timely: 793252/2100000 (37.77%)
    Head correct: 626218/2100000 (29.82%)
    Head timely: 354135/2100000 (16.86%)
  Sync committees: 4894/11264 (43.45%)
```

Proposals look mostly okay but attestations are comepletely tanked. So even with enough proposers doing their duty (Albeit late), we're not going to be able to see a stable chain come out of this experiment. 

So we'd keep it around another ~17 hours (11AM CEST tomorrow) and then get rid of the chain. 

It'd be great if you can let us know what data you want us to collect in that time or what access you'd need. 

We're also unsure what the next step would be. The only option now seems to be to drop down the Holesky genesis validator count significantly, perhaps to 1M and try that out in a test. But that would imply we did find an upper limit as to how much the beaconchain can be allowed to grow.

author: potuz
content:
<@491624610215886849> the latest message I have is this one
```
time="2023-08-02 16:28:45" level=debug msg="Gossip message was ignored" agent="teku/teku/v23.6.2+35-g567271fb5f/linux-x86_64/-eclipseadoptium-openjdk64bitservervm-java-17" error="epoch 3 root 0x094f99ab02d5b0d71f54fe3a2309d360eeb6ccca96f91d72c7f8b350533d836b: not a checkpoint in forkchoice" gossip score=23.399976637277764 multiaddress="/ip4/143.198.203.66/tcp/9000" peer id=16Uiu2HAmSkogF8PsSHbriz4N4xzJeRyLqFMhjX6RBCm2sLfwdYd4 prefix=sync topic="/eth2/eec15ee2/beacon_attestation_25/ssz_snappy"
```
This happens during slot 122. Now that looks like Teku sending these bad messages here, pretty pretty late.  Right before that I still get the Lighthouse ones
```
time="2023-08-02 16:28:43" level=debug msg="Gossip message was ignored" agent="Lighthouse/v4.3.0-dfcb336/x86_64-linux" error="epoch 3 root 0x094f99ab02d5b0d71f54fe3a2309d360eeb6ccca96f91d72c7f8b350533d836b: not a checkpoint in forkchoice" gossip score=19.8783684694406 multiaddress="/ip4/157.245.126.68/tcp/9000" peer id=16Uiu2HAmKChEyg9EMg1uwCdj2rtFtviN1stbk1CMNbuiLp1dSDRL prefix=sync topic="/eth2/eec15ee2/beacon_attestation_60/ssz_snappy"
```
